member.name: T:OpcLabs.BaseLib.Components.LinearConverter
member.summary: Converts values using a linear function.

remarks.para: The LinearConverter component provide a linear conversion and its inverse, and also (optionally) allows output value clamping. The linear conversion is useful for proper scaling of values when the underlying value source does not directly have the desired value.
You configure the parameters of the linear conversion so that the X1 value converts to Y1, and the X2 value converts to Y2. Other values are interpolated or extrapolated according to these settings.

For values that fall outside the given limits, you can choose one of the following behaviors:
Normal. The off-limit condition is ignored, the value is converted as usual.
Error. An exception is thrown.
Clamp. The output value is clamped at the limit.

member.summary:
Default value for the , , and
properties.

remarks.para: Equals to , which is generally considered to mean "Warning", and as having higher severity level than , which is generally considered to mean "Caution" or "Advisory". This choice allows to combine the default settings with the use of for advisory purposes.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.BaseLib.Components.StatusToColorConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.exception: When the value is not of any of the supported types.
member.remarks:
Values are converted to colors according to following rules:
null converts to .
A converts to , a converts to , a converts to , and a converts to .
An -typed value converts to .
Empty strings convert to , non-empty strings convert to .
Zero integers convert to , positive integers convert to , negative integers convert to .
A true Boolean converts to , a false Boolean converts to .

member.name: M:OpcLabs.BaseLib.Components.StatusToColorConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.remarks: Conversion in this direction is not supported.
